caption: I usually give really positive reviews but this place is a joke. I literally paid $14 for a 9inch pizza that has a crust no different than MOD pizza and toppings that are marginally better

Best authentic Pizzeria Italiana in Bethesda, period. If you are a wine lover, ask Alessandro to share some of his encyclopedic knowledge on the subject. You will be amazed and he will pick the perfect wine for any occasion. If you are in Bethesda and love brick-oven napolitan style pizza, you can't afford missing this place !!
Tried this place in the past with a friend and I am obsessed since then. I like the excellent mood and fresh dishes and drinks. Keep it up.
Delicious Delicious Delicious 😋
Good tasting pizza.
Great calzons
Best Neapolitan pizza in the area.. so tasty!
Always great food & service
Fast service. We stopped by to order and within 10 min we got our food to go. Very good pizza. I like how they don't burn the crust as some neapolitan pizza places.
I recommend the burrata pizza and as a dessert to share the Nutella mezza luna.
Had a great pizza
Nice place,  consistent quality, good pizza and salads, very good dessert,  especially the tiramisu and the lemon tartuffo!
Food was good...pricey.. but its to be expected in that area...
Great pizza, friendly service, and amazing location. Having a thin slice of pizza while sipping a glass of wine on their terrace is a great experience in nice weather.
Excellent service and food.
Very well kept and accessible spot. They provide generous meals and for affordable rates. We loved the food very much and the waiters were very attentive and chatty. Highly recommended.
Excellent experience!  Delicious pizza!!
Great Staff, Great Service, Great Food. I Definitely recommend to all.
This is my favorite place to go for pizza if you want to sit outside and eat brick oven pizza. They have great salads. They also have specials which are great.
Great food, good service. Disappointing to see the hostess wearing a face mask that advertised a bold political message.
This spot never disappoints. They serve good dishes for reasonable prices, there are no long waits even when the place is packed.
Nice restaurant, good pizza !

I been food searching this afternoon. I was walking around and found this pizza place called Pizzeria Da Marco. The food here is amazing. The customer service is A+. I like the restaurant atmosphere. If you like pizza, you have to checkout this place. The best part is you can make your own pizza. They use mixed firewood for cooking the pizza in the oven. It definitely make the pizza taste different. Anyway, stop reading this review. If you are in the area, you should check this place out.
Every time I have ordered a pepperoni pizza the cheese falls right off and the crust is soaked with grease. It is more of soup than a pizza, though it does taste delicious.
Fantastic staff doing the best job possible during covid. Great service. Great food
I like this place! great pizza and service.
Great pizza in downtown Bethesda.  Check this place out!
They have the best calzoni, I order the same calzoni every time. The pizza place which I was suggested by a Italian guy.
Never have tiramisu
Excellent pizza. Thanks for being open during the pandemic.
Good Italian Napolitanean original pizza. I can tell you: I’m Italian from Italy!
Great service and menu... food was fantastic!
Best pizzas I have ever had. Good, professional staff.
Pizza was delicious and reminded me of the pizza in Italy. Service was great. Will definitely be back.
Really good pizza.
Really good

The service was spectacular and the food was scrumptious. It is a delightful, laid-back place to be out with good friends for a low-key, comfort food kinda night. Be prepared to spend a bit of time looking for parking on the weekends.
Wonderful, as always!!!
The ambiance feels nice and it gives an appetite for the delicious food they serve. Highly recommended.
Great selection was good. Food was tasty. Great services.
Delicious food, good service.
Happy hour is such a deal. Their pizzas are authentic and crispy made in that oven they brought from Italy (I think). Great wine selection. Perfect place for date night.
Good pizza, friendly service

This place has really great happy hour specials and a extensive amount of food options.  They have a crazy wine list, and 1/2 price wine bottles on Wednesdays.  The service is excellent too.  We had Chris as our server and he was so attentive and friendly.  And last but not least, great pizza!
Very good and kid friendly.
Great pizza! Great beer selection! Great service!
While the styling inside is a bit generic, the service is some of the best I've ever had. Great wine, too, and a convenient location. Great place!

Awesome happy hour specials! Lots of food options and great deals on beer & wine. 1/2 price wine bottles on Wednesdays as well. We enjoyed the margarita pizza along with the bruschetta. Will certainly be back to check out the full menu
The very best pizza in a very long time. Quick and compete service.
High quality pizza. Great service
Authentic Napolitano pizza, killer wine list, great beers and super friendly and attentive staff. Belly up to the bar or in summertime try to snag a patio seat!
Outstanding pizza and good service. Lots of public parking nearby.

I had eaten here in the past and enjoyed it. However, the other night, we drove into Bethesda, paid for parking, and walked up only to find the WHOLE restaurant was closed for an event. I went on the website, and there was nothing announcing this. So I sent a message to them saying I was disappointed that I had paid for parking and then found out they were closed. The manager wrote back saying it was on the website and that they are closing again next month for another event. I wrote back saying that it was not clear on the website at all (who is going to navigate to the ‘Events’ tab??) and that I really wasn’t satisfied. That message got ignored. If the manager had sent us a coupon or something of that nature, I would not be writing this review and would have gone back. But they lost a customer with their poor response to this. Will not be going back, and BEWARE, this place closes down frequently for events.
It's really not fair for me to rate. Not my kind of pizza is all. I tried something else but didn't care for it. The place was packed and the people really seemed to enjoy themselves and the food.
Service was great!
Brussel sprout and sausage pizza 😍
Good place good food

Bethesda....a dearth of good restaurants...individual business owners/restauranteurs are getting pushed out of the area...however, one bright spot exists for genuine Neapolitan style pizza.  If you think 2Amys is good you can experience a similar high quality product, great casual atmosphere in a land of chain restaurants and expensive real estate...good beer and wine selection, good service.  Beautiful, tasty pizza delivered in 90 seconds out of their 900 degree oven.
Delicious food
Consistently great and authentic Italian pizza!
Fun place....pizza was very good.  Family atmosphere....
Great pizza...great atmosphere and service!!
Still delicious but the pizza dough has changed.
Always amazing pizza, and fabulous appetizer. Very consistent and great service. True Pizza Napoletana.
Good pizza
What you basically get here is simply canned food from your local supermarket. We were extremely disappointed.
Excellent margarita pizza

Nice place to have a good pizza and wine at a fair price. The bar area is aldo good and the foccia is a must. Enviroment is clean. Our server was good always there in case we needed something. Highly recommended. Try the happy hour!
Great pizza and unique salads.
Wonderful. Nice service and atmosphere. Pizza and appetizers were delicious. Good wine selection.
Good food and service

Wow we went for happy hour on Sunday, and it was great. Two kinds of pizza, two kinds of dessert, a salad, focacia were all at happy hour prices. The pizza was delicious. Will definitely return. You can view the happy hour menu (which also includes beer and wine) on their website.
Food was good, a little bit on the light side.
Recommend the burrata and pesto pizza

Great happy hour at the bar; it's all day Monday and Tuesday. Wine by the glass is $6 and by the bottle is $20, and you can get a pizza or an appetizer for about half price. The pizzas are a little too big for one but a little too small for two to be full, so get an appetizer or dessert if you're splitting. They also have wonderful seasonal pizzas.

The pizza was okay. The sauce wasn't very flavorful on my pizza and the artichokes were undercooked. The price was pretty good for being in downtown Bethesda, but I'd rather eat at a cheaper place for better pizza.
(Translated by Google) Very good  (Original) Buonissima
Best pizza in Bethesda
Great lunch special salad and pizza for a good price. Both the pizza and salad were good. Service was excellent.
Pizzeria Da Marco offered me excellent service .
Great Pizza, staff was friendly and attentive, definitely recommend.
Great pizza fast
Pizza cooked with Fire so You know it's good!

Super wonderful place. Great waiters Good Happy Hour prices. Fantastic food. Been here dozens of times.  One complaint...small children should not be seated at the bar. I prefer that area be kept for adults and adult conversations. Came in at happy hour and literally half the bar was small children and parents. Sorry- I’m a dad but would prefer the bar space be adults only.

(Translated by Google) Quiet atmosphere. Friendly staff. Good pizza. Quality ingredients. If maybe there was more variety of pizzas ...  (Original) Atmosfera tranquilla. Personale gentile. Pizza buona. Ingredienti di qualità. Se magari ci fosse più varietà di pizze...
Great pizza, reasonably priced. Enjoyed eating outside. The service was friendly and attentive. Cheery inside. Obvious they have a repeat satisfied clientele.

Difficult one to review... Lemme start with the staff: SIX stars. Professional, imitating Italian pronounciation in a surprisingly good way, kind and attentive. And then the food. It’s not that it is bad. But is it good to be called “authentic” Italian? No. But does it mean that around in Bethesda there is a plethora of better joints with Italian food? Definitely not. So if you long for such time of food this looks like the best in vicinity. Yet if you want REAL thing go to Italy, NYC or... Moab.
This is proper pizza, with excellent service!
Really like their pizza dough here. Good variety of specialty pizzas. Nice wine selection. Desserts are pretty good too.
Incredible pizza, very much worth the small pricey expenditures
Excellent pizza. Just like they do it in Italy. Really. Our server was very attentive, and took time to walk us through our options. Great ambience.

This restaurant has THE ABSOLUTE BEST PIZZA!!! Perfectly thin crust with a harmonious balance of chewiness and crispiness. There is a vast assortment of toppings, small plates and beverages... The space is ideal for an intimate first date, family style meal or a even festive celebration. A definite repeat for me.
Pizza was just alright, but I love the lighting and decor of the restaurant. Definitely the fanciest pizza place in Bethesda.
Outstanding pizza made in the Neapolitan style at reasonable prices...many additional choices on menu, too.
Excellent pizza. Thin crust. Well baked. Excellent mista salad. Lunch special is a great value.

This is our new go-to pizza place! We came later in the evening after a disappointing dinner at another restaurant and grabbed a table in the bar area. We ordered a burrata with prosciutto, which was very good. We also ordered the spinach pizza. It came out quickly and was delicious. The crust was nice and chewy and had a pleasant wood-fired taste. In terms of drinks, they definitely favored wine but had a good selection of cocktails and some local beer options on tap.
Service was okay. Food was superb!
Just so so
Awesome taste and ambiance
Great Place Great Staff
Good italian pizza
Great Italian-style pizza!
Great food here! My new favorite pizzeria in Bethesda.
Our favorite pizza is here.
We shared a large pizza, which turned out to be the perfect amount of food for two.
A little pricey, but very good and authentic.

A business buddy of mine always comes here for happy hour, so I decided to join him for once.  The service was great, and I loved their beer selection.  They have tons of unique beers compared to the rest of the bars around the area, and their happy hour specials for food and drink are really good.  The only reason I'm knocking off one star is that the pizza is not very filling.  It tasted good, but was very light and airy.
Very authentic pizza
Real Pizza. I hope you know what I mean when I say real. And I give them 5 stars for food and service. Pizzeria Da Marco is the real deal.
This place is awesome!!
the one of the best pizza i ever meet
Wonderful variety in the menu. Ingredients are fresh and delicious.
Awesome experience!! Fun and friendly staff great food!!!
Great happy hour. Friendly bar service.
Great staff and even better pizza my Kids love lt
Tastes pretty close to pizza I've had in Italy. Easily the Closest thing to authentic Italian pizza in the MD suburbs
Verry especial best service
Not my favorite pizza but the drinks were yummy. Would definitely recommend for girls nights or happy hours.
The crust is soggy
Decent pizza place but somewhat overpriced.  Pros: Good service and seating.  Cons: Pizza is expensive and somewhat soggy.
Great place for pizza in MD. Both food and service were great!

So they have great deals on happy hour which is way longer than most happy hours, and half price bottles of wine if you hit the right night, but the food and atmosphere is so-so.  I wanted to like the place more, and the food really wasn't bad, I guess I just had higher expectations.  Either way, if you are looking for decent food cheap, this can be a great option on a week night with happy hour specials.
Great pizza
Good food; Burrata on the pizza was amazing!!
This is the wonderful very original place which I'm planning to visit as often as l am in the area.
Great food, reasonably priced.
Consistantly good food.
Stopped in for a quick meal before heading out of town. Great food and fast, courteous service.
Great family restaurant for high end pizza
If you want to taste the most italian pizza, this is your place. Good food at reasonable price.

Great Italian style pizza and lovely service. Came in here around mid afternoon and practically had the place to ourselves. The salad was plenty big to share to get us started and the stuffed peppers were a good pairing for appetizers. The pizzas are big enough to share, especially after appetizers, but they made for some delicious leftovers!

Was a little surprised to find myself alone during early dinner hours, but place filled up quick a bit later.  Haven't had such a great pie in a very long time.  Shared a couple of fish salads- and they were Amazing
Delicious pizza and a surprisingly kid-friendly atmosphere. I would definitely dine here again.
Real Italian Pizza
Yummy pizza, great happy hour and wine specials everyday, and friendly staff; this place is one of my Bethesda favorites.
Great place to eat pizza the list of wine is great
Great for lunch
Great pizza and great service!

Great Pizzeria!! I was craving pizza since a while and my boyfriend took me here as I am Italian and he knows how much I cannot stand those junk pizzas like dominos etc. THE PIZZA HERE WAS AS GOOD AS YOU CAN get in some Italian pizzerias! And I have to say it's for a decent price considering how expensive restaurants tend to be in the area. P.s. try the cannoli! They are (finally!) crunchy and not overwhelmingly sweet. Bravi! tornerò presto.
Authentic Italian pizzas. Quite costly but I think it's worth it. Lots of different options. Know that the pizza is quite soft and thin which might be everyone's favorite type of pizza.
It's tasty but small.
Good food and ok service. Very reasonably priced with parking available across the street.
As close to Napolitano pizza as  you'll get without actually going there.
So delicious! My Italian friend assures me its authentic, but all I want care about is how good it is. Fresh mozzarella makes the pizza for me. And really good happy hour specials.
Best pizza ever in us
Poor service. Called for reservations: don't take any if party is less than 8 people. Show up with a party of 6 and then have to wait for 30 min or more. Not worthy..... Extremely disappointed!!
Great food. Great service.
Great pizza and salads.  Staff is kind and helpful.  Make sure you order the bruschetta!
Eh, it's okay.
Good place to eat pizza
This is one of my fav pizza places in Bethesda. Amazing, authentic Italian pizza, apps, salads, wonderful outdoor dining patio, AND... They have half-price bottles of wine and beer on Wednesdays! 👍👍
Incredible and delicious truly italian genuine pizza!
The old family traditional pizza - this is the place
A great place to eat We love it Have gone there on occasion for 5 year, the owner is from Naples as is the pizza oven,!!
Kind of expensive. The dishes are small but good. The service is ok
Excellent pizza. Good salads

+ bruschetta was tasty + ingredients were fresh  - service took quite a while. Food arrived a full hour after we were seated. - pizza crust was soggy on half of our orders. True Italian fashion is a firm bottom and not crispy edges. Soggy is not a plus. - had to flag down other staff to get the attention of our waiter. - our waiter started removing plates we were still eating from.  While the pizza had an authentic flair similar to that of Rome or Florence, it largely missed the bar in terms of service.
If you want a pizza like in Rome, this is the closest thing I can find in the DMV
(Translated by Google) Excellent pizza and nice place !!  (Original) Ottima pizza e bel locale!!
Great happy hour deals on food and wine--especially on Wednesdays!
One of my favorite restaurants in Bethesda!  I make sure to come here when I am in town.  Excellent food and excellent service!
Very good, had an octopus as an appetizer, pizza as the entree, and tiramisu as the dessert. Officially full and satisfied!

Pizzeria di Marco serves the best Bresaola that I have ever had. It is perfectly balanced. The truffle oil is gently present, artistically coating each masterly layered, thinly sliced round. An expert sprinkling of Parmigiano-Reggiano rounds out the salinity, which is only further complemented by the earthy spiciness of raw arugula. I cannot say enough positive things about this dish. It is a classic, and they hit a homerun. Their Pizza, however, is too chewy for my taste, but has some solid flavor. I ate the solo carne. They offer a respectable assortment of amaros. There wine by the glass options are meager, and overall sweet and fruity, but they have well-stocked library of wines by the bottle.
Good pizza, served quicklyband with all smile.
Great food and atmosphere.
Pizza amazing. Caprese made with "winter" tomato. Lunch time service not very attentive.
Delicious pizzas and appetizers, friendly and extremely helpful staff - great experience!
Do not go anywhere else in Bethesda for Pizza. Really great. Full bar, great happy hour and friendly, family-run atmosphere
Excellence choice. Great food and nice people.
Very good pizza, unfriendly owner
Always good!
Good pizza
Their pizza is amazing!

The restaurant itself offers a nice atmosphere. The pizza on the other hand is the worst pizza I have ever had. The toppings appeared not fresh, the meat cheap, and marinara sauce generic. The manager explained that I did not have an understanding of what Italien pizza tastes like. I have to say she was mistaken as I grew up in Europe living as close to the source you can get. As a matter of fact, if authentic Italian pizza ever tastes like that, I will never have one again. Thank you for not comping the meal that we had barely touched.
Amazing, authentic pizza Napoletano ...
Best pizza in the DC area
Great margarita pizza, also tried their buratta and fogaccia. Great spot for a date in Bethesda
Pizza recipe directly from the old country
(Translated by Google) The pizza is like the Italian one. Bravi  (Original) La pizza è come quella Italiana. Bravi
Food was good but why dont they have chicken?? But overall, it was a good experience
Nice family atmosphere.  Service was prompt and please despite the high traffic volume.
Great Food, good staff, cozy atmosphere.
Best pizza I ever had. I WILL go back

Very cozy, chill place that serves one of the best pizzas in Bethesda. Authentic approved by my French and Italian friends. Good prices and very nice and attentive personnel, on Wednesday’s they have half off bottle of wine!  Their eggplant parmigiana is my favorite one must try it, and everything else on the menu is fresh and yummy!
Food was great, service was good and beers are half price on Wednesdays
Best pizza that I have had since moving to Bethesda. I would recommend going during happy hour.
Delicious
Pizza is fantastic and the service is great
Great beer.
Delicious pizza, I think coal oven pizza , crust Is yummy
Interesting-tasting Arnold Palmer, but wonderful pizza. Servers were very attentive to such a large party (almost 20 teenagers).
Exerllemcr food and perfect service. They have half price for all wines in Wednesday nights. A perfect choice for dinner in this area.
Best pizza in Bethesda, if not the entire DC area! Will definitely come back for awesome pizza and great service.

Went with the whole family and had a lovely time. Super yummy pizza, excellent prices, and nice cozy/casual atmosphere. For parties of 8 or more they will accept reservations. Highly recommend the spinaci pizza - that ended up being our favorite but all were very very good. Dessert Nutella pizza is awesome too!
Pizza is always great and people is very nice.
Excellent food. Wednesday is half price bottles of wine.

This is a very solid place, and one of the only ones that offers a Happy Hour on the weekend. That's the reason my wife and I originally came in, and it's the reason we keep coming back! Simply put, if it's the weekend and you're looking for a happy hour - this is your option. I'm not sure when it starts, but it ends at 7pm.  The food itself is generally pretty good, depending on what you order. We like the pizzas, so we usually stick to that. A regular pizza on happy hour is $5-6 and then you can add toppings at regular price. I recommend that Sopressata or the olives! We have had the olive repiene and the mini sweet peppers stuffed with sausages, and they were just OK. We also ahd the bruschetta though, and that was great!  One of the best things about this place is also the speed. They have a brick oven that is incredibly hot, so pizzas take pretty much a few minutes to come out, it's always amazing. It always feels like you order and it shows up seconds later.  Another great thing is Patrick, he's the bartender and he's always very friendly and on top of drinks.
Pizza is great, and the happy hour special is affordable
Good food, great location!
I love their happy hour! I'll definitively be back.

Me and my wife are regulars for the past yr and after the way we got treated today I don't think we will be going back.  We put our names down to be seated and waited for a full hour and left.  The reason we left is bc the host kept telling us we were next while he seated other guests that came after us.  When I looked on the sheet our names were already crossed off when we were not seated.  Get a better host or a proper queue for ur customers to be seated
Good food, good service, nice atmosphere, no where to park.

I am truly bewildered as to why Yelp has such high ratings for this place.  Frankly, my one and only visit today was enough - I'm not wasting my money again.  I went today with my wife and a friend.  We started with salads, including a Mediterranean Salad that boasted heirloom tomatoes (they were cherry tomatoes), and another that included tomatoes, eggplant and mozzarella cheese - the waiter said these too were heirloom tomatoes, but they were plum tomatoes.  Bad start.  Ok, we order a Sicilian pizza and a Calzone.  The restaurant specializes in Neopolitan style pizza.  The food arrives cold, tasteless and barely cooked.  These guys boast of their 900° oven.  The place was 25% occupied - there was no hurry.  None.  The waiter asks, "how's your meal?".  I tell him of my disappointment, but he didn't seem to care.  Oh well.  They won't see any more of me..... What concerns me more than a bad meal is what's the deal with Yelp?  An anomaly?  Did Marco have all his relatives do the reviews? What's going on?

It was really good pizza. The dough was great, sauce had a great flavor, and the toppings were perfect. The mini pepper appetizer I had was probably the best thing we had though. I will probably make it back.
Great pizza great beer great people nuff said!
Love this place. Great staff. Amazing authentic food and always a wonderful time!
Great pizza
Good orange salad and pizza. Enough for two. Will go back. Nice sized glass of wine, unlike some restaurants in Bethesda.
I love this place every time I go back I pay this place a visit. The pizzas are great
Great food and atmosphere
Amazing pizza what else do you want
(Translated by Google) Very rich!!!  (Original) Muy rico!!!
Just ok
The pizza crust is soggy and the toppings are not in the least bit tasty. I will not be going back.
Quality Neapolitan pizza

Great environment, outstanding real Italian pizza.  A little more pricy  than other equivalent level places, but still an excellent choice for a Pizzza e birra night (sorry I haven't try the other dishes on the menu)
Great Naples style pizza. Love that slightly crisp chewy crust. Good range of choices, nice open casual space.
My favorite place for pizza, honestly! Great happy hour menu and a very nice atmosphere
Ok.
Can't beat the pizza here!

After checking out a lot of  Bethesda restaurants, we are so glad we chose Pizzeria Da Marco for a special birthday dinner (18 guests).  Their private room is  beautiful: high ceilings, tall windows, charming decor. The food was wonderful ,from the antipasto, the variety of pizzas and original salads, to their own delicious gelato. The cost for the food and wine was very reasonable. It seemed the goal of the owners, managers, and waitstaff was to make sure that all of us had a fantastic meal and a memorable evening.  They succeeded!
The pizzas are amazing. The hapoy hour menu is very good.
Really good food.  Pizza just like you would find in Naples.
(Translated by Google) Very good attention. Excellent prices. Good food.  (Original) Muy buena atención. Excelentes precios. Buena comida.
Pizza was soo good.  Best spot in town
Excellent pizza
Good salads and  traditional Italian pizza.
Pizza is authentic and the toppings are always unique. Get the salted caramel, trust me. It's so rich, creamy, and sweet. Perfect ending to a meal.
Amazing wood fired pizza. Service is outstanding.
I love 🍕!!
Always great service and one of the best pizza's in Bethesda

We love visiting Pizzeria David Marco! Great salads, appetizers, canzone and pizzas.  Big variety of pizzas.  They don't have many other options but the pizzas are heaven.  Great place for the kids yet nice enough for a first date.  Staff is superb and the wine and beer list is very good.  Next time you're in the mood for real pizza give it a try.  You won't be sorry!
Great authentic Neapolitan pizza
Like home away from home!
They say it is Italian, but it is too soft, too wet. A good Italian pizza tastes different. And yes I have already been to Italy and can compare.
Very good italian pizza!!! They have a wood oven and the pizza is cooked just perfect! Nice stylish place, good for families and groups. If you want a romantic dinner, avoid the weekend.
Excellent pizza!
Great authentic Napolitano pizzeria
Best pizza in DC area; no contest. Great, attentive staff and owner. Everything is good, fresh and perfectly prepared. Lots of repeat regulars, including me. Weekly 'go-to' spot

Excellent Neapolitan style pizza. Ingredients are hand-picked, especially for certain pizzas, like the Margherita D.O.P which comes with original Italian Mozzarella di bufala (whereas the classic Margherita has American mozzarella in it). The antipasto with affettati misti (a cutting board with salami, prosciutto, mortadella and smoked prosciutto) is excellent and comes with a brick oven baked focaccia. Their Achilles' heel are the desserts, which are not quite up to snuff.
Friendly staff and food is delicious.
Pizza arrived at table just barely warm and absolutely soggy, basically just a wet puddle in the middle. Crust was very blond, virtually no char at all. Not recommended.
My favorite napoletana pizza in DMV area. The meatballs are to die for! Efficient service and decent wine.
Great scenery and decerations, would go again. Marvelous food, wide range of drink choice. Just feels like it's missing something

We have been going to Da Marco's since it opened - it is the most authentic and fresh pizza we've had in the area.  The service has always been wonderful, and it is one of the few restaurants my 8 yo daughter asks to go to!
Mediocre food, bad pizza...

Service was rubbish. Waitress did not accommodate for our needs and sent her attention more to the table with 50 people (no surprise there). My aunt asked why there was such a little amount of wine in her glass, the waitress said that they offer a 6 ounce glass for $9 compared to other places which offer an 8 ounce glass for $10. The food wasn't great either, all three of us complained that the pizza was too soggy. I tried to lift a slice up with my hands and all the toppings slid off of the pizza. I will not be returning here.

Possibly my favorite spot in Bethesda for happy hours. Great pizza, nice beer and wine selection, and long happy hour hours (4-7 every day, all evening on Monday and Tuesdays!). The pizzas are great any time, but a particularly good deal at happy hour. And save room for the Nutella canzone for dessert.
The best neopalitan pizza this side of Italy! The staff is awesome!!
Great Neapolitan pizza. One if DC's best

I've been here twice and both times I've had amazing service and was well fed. They deal well with allergies (my nephew is highly allergic to egg and nuts). They are fast, knowledgable, and authentic italian!
Great italian pizza!
As a fellow Neapolitan, their pizza is the best I've eaten since Naples.
No cocktails, but great wine and beer selection. I didn't eat the food though.
Excellent pizza with a poor beer list.
Excellent DOC pizza place.  Brick oven, wood fired.  Service was good. Pizza was excellent.  Surprised that the Resteraunt was mostly empty.
Wonderful authentic Italian food. Will definitely go again when in the area.
Outstanding!!!

So, here's the deal: Authentic Italian brick oven pizza that comes with choice of all reasonable flavors/toppings, Italian staff (with American help) working with the enthusiasm of true restaurateurs who strive to simply make the customer's experience enjoyable (and very palatable even with always novel, yummy home-made appetizers!), and exceptional ambiance perfectly (and miraculously!) balanced for a couple, an entire family with kids and grandparents, or just for you alone if you feel like enjoying the bar and the "American-style" TV watching while sipping your favorite glass (beer and wine selection are wide and well thought out). Nothing better to enjoy a simple evening in Italy out of Italy!

Terrible service, waitress just stayed on the back never really attended after getting order. The Pizza is alright but not impressive.   Needs more work on the kitchen, a lot of noise for the style of the restaurant, workers drinking alcoholic beverages during work; not appropriate.
Love the variety of pizza here and they are all completely fresh.

Great pizza! Delicious thin crust and great sauce. But the service is woefully slow. No one took our order for a.   Really.   Long.  Time. No mention of the specials ( we over heard them telling the next table) and after the pizza came, another wait for the red pepper as the pizza cooled. Too bad: like I said, the food is tasty but the waiting drags. We'll go back but with some reservations about the wait time
(Translated by Google) The pizza is very good! I recommend it! Fast service!  (Original) La pizza es muy buena! Lo recomiendo! Servicio rapido!

Pizzeria Da Marco makes decent thin crust pizzas. Ingredients are fresh, sauce is tasty and not too acidic, crusts are nicely charred. The space is large and comfortable. Service is slow and disinterested. Prices are fair.
The pizza was pretty good, and the service was good; but I will likely not go back, simply due to the fact that it wasn't stellar and there are other places in the greater DC area that are.
Great place

Europe has finally made it to America. Having been to Italy, and Eatly NY, this place fits in such a league.   I would rate it at least as good if not better as the local gems like it pizzico and Oro in Rockville.  At these prices with such flavors that pop reflecting the quality of ingredients, what more can you ask for?   Please, don't change your fantastic olive oil, tomato sauce, and buffalo.   I would only suggest that the crust could be more than and supple and service could be a little more attentive.  Overall the best deal in town, and a place you can frequent happily.

An excellent brick oven pizza restaurant with tasty salad options as well. Ingredients are definitely fresh and the prices are reasonable. They have an outdoor patio which is great for summer. I definitely recommend this place for a casual meal out.

Just ate here for dinner and was surprised how good it was. I heard mixed reviews from multiple sources but honestly I'd eat here again several times over. That being said, I'm still looking forward to eating there during happy hour.

The pizza is true Neapolitan pizza. They have their certification from Associazione Verace Pizza Napoletana. This is not typical American pizza, it is the real thing like you would get in Naples and yes, I have been to Naples and know the difference.  It may not be everyone's taste, but it is very good and authentic. I enjoy it. You can still eat well here as the other Italian foods are good, but try the pizza and see what the original is all about.
You didnt walk out of there feeling overly fed or stuffed. It was absolutely delicious and both times I have been, the wait staff has been very good.

One of my favorite pizzerias. It's worth the visit for the antipasto alone.  It comes with a plain pizza crust (focaccia) which is fabulous!  Sometimes the very center of the pizzas are a bit soggy, but otherwise this is a 5star experience.

Magazine write-up noted crispy thin crust pizza - not remotely crispy. focaccia is merely naked pizza dough with rosemary sprigs and an occasional slice of garlic. With that said, the flavors were generally good, but somewhat bland. Open, airy place with good prompt service - don't expect much and you will be pleasantly surprised.
